title: Storing Cut Vegetables (Onions and Bell Peppers)

items.name: Half onion storage
items.details: Store cut-side down in an airtight container or tightly wrapped in plastic wrap in the crisper drawer. Leave the skin on if possible. Keeps 5-7 days. Toss if it smells sour or feels slimy.

items.name: Half onion - do not leave exposed
items.details: Uncovered onion dries out and stinks up the fridge. Never store cut onion at room temperature.

items.name: Freeze unused onion
items.details: If you won't use the half onion within a few days, dice it and freeze it for cooking later.

items.name: Sliced bell peppers
items.details: Store in an airtight container or zip-top bag lined with a paper towel to absorb moisture. Keep in the crisper drawer. Lasts 3-5 days, up to 7 if very fresh and kept dry.

items.name: Bell pepper tips
items.details: Do not wash before storing - wash right before use. Do not leave uncovered or in a loose bag.

items.name: Freeze bell pepper slices
items.details: Frozen slices work great for stir-fries, fajitas, and omelets, but not for eating raw.

notes: The paper towel trick for bell peppers is key - moisture is the enemy of freshness for cut peppers. For both onions and peppers, the airtight seal is critical for extending shelf life.
